name: Research Project in Criminology, Law and Society
description: This is a seminar course where students pursue advanced research supervised by a faculty member in Criminology, Law and Society. Students develop a research proposal, conduct independent research, analyze data and present findings. Admission by academic merit. Interested students should submit an application to the Department of Sociology (see website for details). Preference given to eligible Criminology, Law and Society Specialists and Majors. [24S]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/SOC231H5, SOC221H5, SOC222H5, 4th Year Standing, P.I.
